incidents.name: New Marketing Campaigns Delays

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

It was discovered that customers attempting to send new single sends within the down period may have received credit usage errors. Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 2:53 PM PST on January 11th, our engineers began investigating an issue with sending via the new Marketing Campaigns. Customers may see delays with scheduled Single Sends. This currently impacts all mail using SingleSends, Automations, and SendTests. Legacy Marketing and Mail Send API are not impacted. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Unable to load list details - 500 Internal Server Errors

incident_updates.body:
From 11.24PM PST 1/10/2023 to 1:31AM PT 1/11/2023, we experienced an issue with Legacy Marketing Contacts. 
Customers may have received the error message - Unable to load list details, which affected adding of contact lists/segments to the legacy marketing campaigns. 
This issue has been mitigated and resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

incidents.name: Errors when Attempting to Assign or Unassign IPs to Subusers

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

A fix has been implemented and customers should no longer see errors when assigning or un-assigning IPs to subusers via the API or within the UI. 

The fix has also resolved the inability to reach Support via the Support Portal. Customers should now be able to utilize chats and submit tickets as expected. We will provide another update within an hour or sooner if more information becomes available.

Starting around 3:34 PM PT on January 9, 2022, our engineers began investigating an issue with endpoints related to assigning IPs to subusers. Customer may receive a 500 response when accessing any /v3/send_ips/pools/ endpoints or attempting to assign or unassign IPs to subusers. This does not impact the mail send endpoint. 

This also impacts customer's ability to contact Support. Customers can submit a ticket to help@sendgrid.com in the meantime. You can reach our support team at  We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Images uploaded to Legacy are not loading anymore

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the current issue with Legacy Design Editor, they have deployed to determine a workaround, users must re-upload their images have to their legacy libraries. All services should operate normally by performing this change.

Upon further investigation, our engineering team determined that on December 19, 2022, a new change to the host of the Legacy Editor was made that resulted in these issues.

We changed our host from AWS to CloudFront.

Our engineers recommended re-uploading their images so they can be assigned to the new URL containing the CloudFront Host. Also, recommending to update their payloads so the links used are the CloudFront ones instead of the AWS.

This did not impact Marketing campaigns.

This did not impact mail send. 

Our team will monitor the reverted changes for the next 30 minutes or provide further information as it becomes available.

Starting around 9:00 on Monday 19th, 2022, our engineers began investigating an issue with Legacy Design Editor. Customer may experience their images not being loaded when using Legacy editor, the error shows: "This XML file does not appear to have any style information associated with it. The document tree is shown below.". This is only affecting Legacy customers. 

This doesn't affect Marketing campaigns.

This doesn't impact mail send. 

We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Password Reset Link Expired Upon Delivery

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the code deployment reversion and confirmed that previous problems with invalid SendGrid password reset tokens is now resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Upon further investigation, our engineering team determined that at 11:30 A.M. PT on December 12, 2022, a code deployment unintentionally caused the known invalidation of password reset tokens for SendGrid password reset links.  At 1:06 P.M. PT today, our team reverted the deploy that resulted in these issues.  Reviewing the reverted deployment, these changes are confirmed to now allow for successful password reset links with valid tokens for SendGrid. This did not impact mail send. Our team will monitor the reverted changes for the next 30 minutes or provide further information as it becomes available.

Starting around 11:55 A.M. PT on December 12, 2022, our engineers began investigating an issue with password reset links expiring upon delivery when requested through the password reset page in the browser. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. Customers should be able to log in using 2FA.

Our engineers are currently investigating this and we will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: EASE - Activity Feed not showing recent events

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated and resolved an issue with Email Activity Feed not showing recent events. From 7:59 PM PST to 01:47 AM PST some customers may not have been able to see recent events in the Email Activity Feed. The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Single Sends can't be sent

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with Single Sends has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our engineers are noticing improvements in Single Sends. Queued emails are currently flowing and segments are being updated. We will continue to monitor the outage with our vendor as things improve. We will provide another update in the next two hours, or as soon as more information becomes available.
We are continuing to investigate this issue. We will provide another update in two hours, or as soon as more information becomes available.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Engineers had ultimately identified what originally was causing Single Sends to not trigger and go out. However, although customers are now able to trigger Single Sends, due to an ongoing outage with one of our third party vendors, mail events are delayed as of 8 am PT today. Additionally, Single Sends using segments have not been updated since 8 am PT, and will not update until mail events are processed. Mail events will be processed when the vendor outage has been resolved. Single Sends using lists are processing as normal. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. Customers are now able to send Single Sends via Marketing Campaigns at this time. Single Sends triggered during the time of this incident have also be sent out at this time. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. We will provide another update in hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.

Beginning 8:30 AM PT on November 23, our engineers began investigating an issue with sending test emails and Single Sends within Marketing Campaigns.

Customers may see the following error when attempting to send the Single Send: "We were unable to send your test. Please verify email addresses are valid and separated by a comma, and try again."

This only affects mail sent via Marketing Campaigns. Customers are able to initiate the sends, but they will not trigger and stats won't display correctly.

We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Delayed Suppressions Information

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed that all delayed suppressions data is now posted to the system as expected. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our engineers have confirmed that the suppressions data is now posted as expected and suppressions delays related to this incident are resolved. Our team will continue monitoring the stability of the affected system for the next 30 minutes for any further anomalies. We will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more updates are available.

The SendGrid system responsible for dequeuing suppressions data is continuing to stabilize but delays will be present until the system is back to normal operation. Suppressions will continue to potentially be delayed for up to 30 to 40 minutes from when an affected suppression was originally recorded. Another update will be provided in the next two hours or as soon as more information is available.

Our engineering team confirmed that delayed suppressions data is dequeuing from the affected SendGrid system. Suppressions will continue to be delayed for up to 30 to 40 minutes from when an affected suppression was originally recorded. Delays are expected to continue until we confirm this incident to be in a monitoring state. Delay time and impact will vary between different SendGrid accounts. Another update will be provided in the next hour or as soon as more information is available.

Beginning 2:11 PM Pacific Time, our engineers determined that new suppression information is being delayed before getting posted to the SendGrid system. This includes delays retrieving suppression information in the user interface along with using the SendGrid Suppressions API. This does not affect mail send.  Another update will be provided in the next hour or as soon as more information is available.

incidents.name: Delayed SendGrid Email Statistics

incident_updates.body: Our team has rectified the stats delays for affected statistics.All services are now operating normally at this time. We thank you for your patience as we worked to resolve this.
We are continuing to monitor the resolution of this issue. We will provide another update in the next 24 hours or as soon as possible.

Beginning at 1:26 PM PT on November 16th, our engineering team determined that various statistic types for SendGrid were posted with more delays than expected. Users accessing Mailbox Provider Stats, Email Clients & Devices Stats, Browser Stats, Geographical Stats, and Monthly/Weekly Category Stats are delayed up to 48 hours before being posted to the SendGrid system.  Global Stats and Daily Category Stats are not affected.

These stats delays do not impact mail send.  Stats posting delays will vary between users.

Our engineering team made a deploy to rectify delays in the affected statistics.  These deployed changes are anticipated to stabilize the SendGrid stats posting system but will require time to finalize.   Statistics may continue to have delays until this incident is resolved.

Another update will be provided within the next 24 hours or as soon as more information is available.

incidents.name: Users Missing Daily Stats Counts Within the User Interface

incident_updates.body: Our team has restored all category stats from October 11 to October 24 adhering to the category limits we enforce. All systems related to category stats are operational now.
Our teams are continuing to work on the implementation of the solution.  We will provide another update in 5 hours or sooner if applicable.

From 12:00AM October 11th to 12:00AM October 24th in the users respective timezone, our system that limits category stats went into a degraded state. This resulted in the user interface not receiving event counts for the given time. Customers searching category stats retroactively from October 11 to October 24 may see inaccurate event counts. Category stats from October 25 to the current date should be correct.  Our teams have found a resolution and are working on the implementation.  We will provide more updates as they come.

incidents.name: API Key and Session Token Validation Failures

incident_updates.body: From 10:55 AM PDT to 1:13 PM PDT on Monday October 31st, we experienced an issue with API key and session token validations. Customers may have received an increase in HTTP 401 "Unauthorized" errors when making calls to endpoints other than mail send. Users may also have seen an increase in latency and/or HTTP 500 errors when loading pages in the SendGrid console. This issue has now been resolved and all services are fully operational.

Customers should begin to see password reset emails, two-factor authentication confirmation and sign-up confirmation emails properly coming through. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Unable to add new IP Address

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have been monitoring the fix and have confirmed that the problem with adding new IP addresses has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

A fix has been implemented by the third-party provider and the customers are now able to add new dedicated IPs from the user interface. Our team will continue to monitor the performance of our systems. We will provide an update within an hour or sooner if more information is available.
The third-party issue is still ongoing. Impact has not changed. We apologize for the inconvenience. We will provide another update as soon as more information becomes available.

The third-party problem is still present. The current impact continues to affect attempts to add an IP from the user interface. As a workaround, customers can add IPs via API: https://docs.sendgrid.com/api-reference/ip-address/add-ips. We will provide another update in two hours, or as soon as more information becomes available.

On October 6th, around 11:00 PM PST, our engineering team identified an issue with adding new dedicated IPs. It appears to be the result of a problem on a third-party provider side. When attempting to add a new dedicated IP from UI, customers would see a message stating that "We're sorry, we were unable to add the new IP address. Please try again.". This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: 500 Errors Being Returned Within Marketing Campaigns When Attempting To Retrieve Contacts or Lists

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with the contacts interface has been resolved. All customers should now be able to access Marketing Contacts as expected.
Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. We will provide another update in hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 8:00 AM MT on Tuesday September 27th, our engineers began investigating an issue with the marketing campaigns contacts. Users may experience 500 errors when attempting to retrieve contacts or lists. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Intermittent 502 Errors when using SendGrid API

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated and resolved the issues with SendGrid API endpoints intermittently returning 502 errors. From 01:38 PM PST to 04:12 PM PST, customers may have encountered intermittent 502 errors when attempting to utilize SendGrid API endpoints associated with Marketing Campaigns, Account Details and Management, the Event Webhook, and Suppressions. This issue did not affect the Mail Send API and Mail Sending was not affected. The issue has been resolved, and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Removal of IP Addresses from Azure reseller customers with multiple dedicated IP Addresses

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with removal of secondary dedicated IPs on Azure Reseller accounts has been resolved. Impacted users should now see their secondary IPs active in their accounts. All services are now operating normally at this time.
We are continuing to monitor the fix put in place for any additional impact. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as any additional information becomes available.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. Impacted Azure Reseller Customers should begin seeing their secondary dedicatede IPs added back to their accounts and enabled for sending. We will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue and are working towards a fix in regards to the removal of secondary dedicated IPs on Azure Reseller accounts. Affected users may still experience degraded mail send capabilities. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 10:47am PT on 09/13/2022, our engineers began investigating an issue with certain Azure Reseller Customers with multiple dedicated IP addresses seeing one of them removed from their account without user intervention. Customers impacted may have experienced mail send disruption sent through the secondary IPs on their account. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Email Activity Exports Not Being Received

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with users not receiving their email activity exports has been resolved. Impacted users will need to re-trigger the export from the activity feed. All services are now operating normally at this time. We thank you for your patience as we worked to resolve this.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. Newly requested email activity exports should be received as expected, if you had previously requested a CSV export from the activity feed please go ahead and try exporting again. We will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. We will provide another update in the next hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
We are continuing to investigate this issue. We will provide another update within one hour or sooner if more information becomes available.
We are continuing to investigate this issue. We will provide another update within one hour or sooner as more information becomes available.

Starting around 12:35pm PT on September 10th, 2022, our engineers began investigating an issue with email activity export emails not being received by customers. Users who are triggering an activity feed export from their SendGrid Account may not receive the subsequent email containing the export. Searching in the activity feed still functions as expected as well as the API endpoints for users with the Email Activity add-on. This does not impact mail send.  We will provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Legacy Marketing Campaigns Displaying Incorrect Stats

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue causing incorrect Legacy Marketing Campaigns Stats has been resolved. No campaigns sent after August 30, 2022 should display incorrect stats. Our engineers are retroactively resolving the impacted campaign stats. Please reach out to our Support Team with any questions.

Our team is continuing to monitor system performance. Customers may still see incorrect stats for mail sent through Legacy Marketing Campaigns between August 26, 2022 and August 30, 2022. We will provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers are continuing to monitor to ensure system performance. At this time customers may still see incorrect stats for mail sent through Legacy Marketing Campaigns between August 26, 2022 and August 30, 2022. We will provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineering team has implemented a fix for the campaigns that will be sent in the future. They are still working on a solution for the users who have already been affected by the exaggerated numbers.
Our engineers are continuing to work towards a fix for this issue. We will provide another update in 4 hours or sooner if more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue causing incorrect Legacy Marketing Campaigns stats and are working toward a fix. We will provide another update in two hours or as sooner as more information becomes available.

We are continuing to investigate this issue. Customers may still see incorrect stats displayed in the Marketing Campaigns UI. We will provide another update within two hours or sooner if more information becomes available.

We are continuing to investigate this issue. Customers may still see incorrect stats displayed in the Marketing Campaigns UI. We will provide another update within an hour or sooner if more information becomes available.

Our engineers are continuing to investigate this issue. Customers may still see incorrect stats displayed in the Marketing Campaigns UI. We will provide another update within an hour or sooner if more information becomes available.

Beginning at 9:45 AM PT on August 30, 2022, our engineers began investigating an issue with Legacy Marketing Campaigns stats. At this time, customers may see inflated stats when reviewing delivered percentages for each campaign within the UI. This does not impact mail sent. We will provide another update within an hour or sooner if more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Stats undercounted for August 4th and 9th

incident_updates.body:
We have identified the impacted customers and the reason for the data discrepancy.
This is not an ongoing issue and we have confirmed that this was an isolated incident where stats on August 4, 2022 and August 9, 2022 were impacted. Our team has crafted a solution to restore the stats and is actively implementing the solution. The stats recovery is expected to take 2-4 weeks. In the meantime, please feel free to contact our support team at support@sendgrid.com should you have any additional questions

Our engineers are continuing to work towards the most optimal solution for data recovery. Customers may still see incorrect stats displayed for August 4, 2022 and August 9, 2022. We will provide another update within 24 hours or sooner if more information becomes available.
We are still evaluating the most optimal solution for data recovery. We'll provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

On August 29th at around 10:40 am PT our teams noticed that the stats for August 4th and 9th were being undercounted. For those dates, this affected global stats specifically geographical, browser, devices, clients, and mailbox provider stats for a subset of customers. The issue has been identified, and the team is working towards a fix. Customers may experience issues with stats from mentioned dates. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Unable to delete API keys

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have confirmed the issue has been resolved. Customer should now be able to delete API keys. All systems are stable at this time.

Beginning at 5:45 PM MT, our systems that delete API keys got degraded and we detected this issue around 10.45 PM MT. During the degradation customers were not able to delete any API keys.  We have put in a fix since then and are currently in monitoring state.  Customers should now be able to delete keys as usual. This doesn't impact mail sending.

incidents.name: Failures to Process Payments, Change Plans or Update Payment Details

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with payment processing has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Previous payments that were delayed are now gradually processing. However, a subset of customers may still experience delays in payment processing, along with changes to plans or updating of billing details. Our team advises allowing up to 24 hours for automated processing of any delayed payments or for manual retries. Our engineers will continue to monitor the performance of our system and provide an update within the next 24 hours or as soon as more information is available.

Our engineers have identified the current billing issues associated to third party providers.  A subset of customers may experience delays in seeing payment or plan upgrades process. There may also be errors when updating the payment method, and when trying to process any previous payments. Mail send is not affected at this time. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 4:00 PM PST on August 3rd, 2022, our team began investigating billing issues. Customers may experience delays in seeing their payments or plan upgrades processed. Mail send is not affected at this time. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: 500 errors from SendGrid V3 API and User interface errors

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have confirmed the issue has been resolved. Customers who were experiencing issues logging in or with 500 errors while performing v3 API calls, should no longer see those issues. All systems are operating normally at this time.

Starting around 9:37 AM PT our engineers identified intermittent issues with login through our User Interface. API mail send wasn't affected, but most of V3 API endpoints were. Customers attempting to hit impacted endpoints would have received a 5xx error during this time. We identified the cause and deployed a fix. We are monitoring this, and we'll provide an update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Shared IP Network Blocked by Spamhaus

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 09:00 am PST on 19th July, 2022, our engineers noticed an issue with the email delivery on our shared IP addresses and are currently investigating. Customers may experience an increase in blocks when sending emails. This will only impact customers on Free, Essentials, or Basic plans using shared IP pools. This does not impact customers using a dedicated IP. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: v2 API Endpoints Degraded

incident_updates.body:
Our engineers have investigated and resolved the issues with the SendGrid v2 API. Between July 11th at 12:37 PM PT and July 12th at 9:48 AM PT calls to the SendGrid v2 API sourced from the US East region may have intermittently failed with 502 or 504 errors. The v2 API mail send endpoint was not impacted by this issue. Additionally, the v3 API was not impacted by this issue.

The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally

incidents.name: 503 errors when using the v2 API

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with the v2 API Stats endpoints has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. Users should no longer be receiving 503 errors when using the v2 API Stats endpoints. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 1:30PM Pacific Time on 7-11-22, our engineers began investigating an issue with the v2 API. Users may experience 503 errors with "Stats" related endpoints. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Technical Incident - Mail Send Delays

incident_updates.body: After monitoring, we confirmed the issue with mail processing delays using ASM has been resolved. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our engineers have implemented a fix for the delayed mail and have monitored that mail has dequeued for the affected period.  We will provide another update within an hour to confirm the issue is resolved or as soon as more information becomes available.

Between 11:05 and 11:45 AM PT on June 29th, our engineers identified an issue with mail processing delays for a small subset of customers that sent mail using Advanced Subscription Management (ASM) during the aforementioned period.  Since this time range and after an internal change, new mail is processing as expected.  We will provide another update within an hour or as soon as more information becomes available while we monitor the stability of the changes that have been deployed.
